name: Yallaiah Onteru
title: AI Applications Engineer
professional_summary: I am having 10 years of experience in developing enterprise-grade AI applications, combining Python backends with Angular front-ends and deploying microservices to cloud platforms, delivering Agentic AI solutions in Insurance, Healthcare, and Banking domains.

Skilled in building full-stack AI applications leveraging Python and Angular to implement complex agentic workflows, collaborating with cross-functional teams including Gen AI scientists and UX designers to translate business requirements into production-ready solutions.

Hands-on experience in deploying containerized microservices on cloud environments using AWS and Azure, orchestrating agentic AI workflows, integrating AI agents, and ensuring enterprise-level scalability and performance for complex business applications.

Proficient in designing generative AI applications and multi-agent systems, implementing model context protocols, and optimizing workflows to achieve autonomous task execution while adhering to domain-specific regulations in Insurance and Healthcare.

Expert in collaborating with product managers and data engineers to translate AI research outputs into practical enterprise-grade applications, performing POCs and prototyping agentic AI solutions to validate approaches before production deployment.

Experience in debugging complex full-stack applications, reviewing code across Python and Angular components, troubleshooting workflow issues in agentic AI systems, and maintaining high reliability for enterprise AI deployments.

Worked extensively on AI pipelines integrating LangGraph, Crew AI, and multi-agent systems for Insurance claims and Healthcare process automation, ensuring robust orchestration and fault-tolerant architectures for mission-critical workflows.

Developed real-time AI microservices using Python and deployed them on Azure with containerization and orchestration, streamlining data flows, automating decision-making, and improving response times for enterprise applications in regulated industries.

Hands-on with testing frameworks for Angular and Python, implementing unit, integration, and end-to-end tests for enterprise AI applications to ensure reliability and compliance with Insurance and Healthcare regulations.

Skilled in designing agent-to-agent communication protocols and multi-agent orchestration using agentic AI frameworks, improving task efficiency, decision-making accuracy, and overall operational intelligence within enterprise applications.

Engaged in performance tuning of Python backends and Angular front-ends to optimize AI workflows, reduce latency, and ensure high availability in cloud-hosted applications for Insurance and Healthcare domains.

Collaborated closely with AI scientists to implement generative AI models, fine-tuning LLMs, and deploying production-ready solutions, transforming AI research into actionable enterprise-grade applications while ensuring regulatory compliance.

Expert in cloud architecture design using Azure and AWS services to support full-stack AI applications, managing deployment pipelines, networking, IAM policies, and ensuring security best practices for enterprise workloads.

Designed and maintained CI/CD pipelines for deploying Python microservices and Angular front-end applications, automating release cycles, and ensuring seamless integration with agentic AI workflows and enterprise IT standards.

Proficient in implementing microservices architecture with Python orchestration layers, integrating data pipelines and AI models, delivering scalable, fault-tolerant, and maintainable enterprise-grade AI solutions.

Experienced in collaborating with cross-functional teams across multiple domains to understand business challenges, design AI-driven solutions, implement agentic AI systems, and ensure measurable business impact with real-world deployments.

Skilled in translating complex AI models and workflows into user-friendly Angular interfaces, ensuring accessibility, responsiveness, and alignment with enterprise-grade UX standards for regulated industries.

Continually learning emerging AI technologies and frameworks, integrating generative AI, agentic AI principles, and cloud-native deployment strategies to drive innovation in Insurance, Healthcare, Banking, and Consulting projects.

responsibilities: Angular to address complex front-end challenges, implemented dynamic dashboards for Insurance agent workflows, improving user efficiency while still figuring out the best component architecture.
Python to orchestrate multi-agent AI workflows, resolved complex data flow issues, enhancing claim processing automation and reducing error rates for Insurance processes.
Azure Data Factory integration to manage pipelines, handled inconsistent input datasets, streamlining ETL for AI agentic workflows in Insurance claims.
Crew AI implementation to automate agent tasks, struggled initially with orchestration conflicts, successfully deployed multi-agent systems for efficient policy handling.
LangGraph to model AI agent interactions, designed proof-of-concept for Insurance decision-making, improving workflow response times while learning complex dependency management.
Docker containerization to standardize deployment, overcame environment mismatch errors, enabling scalable and repeatable deployment of agentic AI services.
Kubernetes AKS orchestration to manage AI microservices, addressed scaling bottlenecks, ensuring high availability of Insurance AI applications.
Python debugging of AI pipelines, fixed runtime exceptions, stabilized enterprise-grade AI agent execution across multiple Insurance workflows.
Angular testing framework to implement unit and integration tests, overcame initial coverage gaps, ensuring UI reliability for agentic Insurance applications.
Azure ML Studio to deploy generative AI models, optimized training workflows, enabling on-demand AI predictions for Insurance claim automation.
OpenAI APIs integration for generative agentic solutions, solved response inconsistencies, enhancing AI agents' decision-making accuracy.
Python and Azure to implement secure backend services, addressed compliance gaps, ensuring Insurance application adhered to enterprise security standards.
Fast API microservice development to handle real-time claim requests, debugged concurrency issues, improving system responsiveness and reliability.
LangChain and multi-agent systems to orchestrate complex workflows, resolved agent conflicts, increasing throughput for Insurance processing pipelines.
Azure Data Factory and Python to automate Insurance data pipelines, resolved transformation errors, improving AI agents' access to accurate and timely datasets.
Crew AI POC experiments for multi-agent decisioning, iteratively tuned workflows, resulting in faster Insurance claim adjudication and team learning.
